page.title: 02TRANSPORT
page.content: When I used to live down Ulceby Skitter I went to the station to watch the trains. Mostly the trains are local passenger trains. I used to count the carriages. Some of them come from the oil refineries at Immingham. Their loads are oil and coal from the coal terminal. Sometimes I go to the station to look round and sometimes I pull the levers in the signal box. We don't get any intercity trains through Ulceby and the reason we can't have them is because they would crash into one of the slow trains. When we go down the Beck that runs near the railway we sometimes go under one of the bridges. When a train goes over it, it is deafening. Our house is right near to the railway line and every night I count the train.There are l3.
